meanings.definition: To separate fibers in the process of spinning or weaving.
meanings.sent1: She carefully stricks the wool fibers before spinning them into yarn.
meanings.sent2: The spinner stricks the fibers to prepare them for weaving.
meanings.sent3: The sheep thought it was funny when she tried to stricks the clouds into yarn.
meanings.sent4: Her fingers moved like a gentle breeze as she stricks the fibers apart.
meanings.sent5: With each gentle pull, she stricks the fibers into a beautiful thread.

meanings.definition: A bundle of fibers used in spinning or weaving.
meanings.sent1: She picked up a colorful stricks of wool to start her weaving project.
meanings.sent2: The stricks of cotton were neatly arranged on the spinning wheel.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten played with the stricks of yarn, unraveling them all over the room.
meanings.sent4: The stricks of silk glistened in the sunlight like precious jewels.
meanings.sent5: Each stricks of fiber held the potential to become a beautiful piece of fabric.
